metadata.title: USN-6909-2 -- Bind vulnerabilities
metadata.description: USN-6909-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in Bind. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Toshifumi Sakaguchi discovered that Bind incorrectly handled having a very  large number of RRs existing at the same time. A remote attacker could  possibly use this issue to cause Bind to consume resources, leading to a  denial of service. (CVE-2024-1737)   It was discovered that Bind incorrectly handled a large number of SIG(0)  signed requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause  Bind to consume resources, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2024-1975)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6909-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  bind9 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 bind9-doc - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 bind9-host - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 bind9utils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 dnsutils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libbind-dev - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libbind-export-dev - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libdns-export1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libdns1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libirs160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libisc-export169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libisc169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libisccc-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libisccc160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libisccfg-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 libisccfg160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 liblwres160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.19+esm4 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
